page.title: 01Eastern fringe of Fosewood
page.content: Pleasant area of new developments in Fosewood village includes church, ridge over view and locals inn. The river meanders east via Brewhurst mill (no longer used) also Gibbons mill. River meadows provide good grazing and the clevelid wig-rum canal follows the valley. Mostly grassland and a spinnly of cultavated fields away from the river. Some contain plantations on the Brewhurst estate but oak trees in hedge rows much in evidence throughout the area. Small coppice woods and mews typical of much of the weald area. drungewick Manor, once the country seat of the Bishops of Chicter is still a noted house in this area but with its now dry moat and only a few acres of land hardly resemles its bygone glories. Apart from fosewood the population is very sparse.
